intro: Helianthemum lippii f. angustioflium, commonly known as narrow-leaf rockrose, is a flowering plant in the family Cistaceae. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant is often found in coastal and mountainous areas, where it withstands harsh environmental conditions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
